Thursday, April 26, 2007























The sun in 3-D
NASA released the first three-dimensional images of the sun Monday, saying the photos taken from twin spacecraft may lead to better predictions of solar eruptions that can affect communications and power lines on Earth.
FULL STORY




















Violent birth of stars
A detailed image released by NASA scientists on shows the chaotic conditions in which stars are born and die.
FULL STORY






Earth-like planet found
Astronomers have found the most Earth-like planet outside our solar system.
FULL STORY






Solar forecast
The peak of the next sunspot cycle is expected in late 2011 or mid-2012.
FULL STORY






'See you in zero G'
For a few seconds on Thursday, astrophysicist Stephen Hawking will float weightless.
FULL STORY
